programme.title: Wild Dogs: Pack vs Pride
programme.sub-title: Run into a lion-hyena showdown with Julz as he hunts for the elusive Manzi pack and join Henry from the Zambian Carnivore Program on a house call to the Kakumbi den where another pup has gone missing.
programme.desc: Cameraman Julz Braatvedt returns to the South Luangwa National Park to see the Kakumbi, Manzi and Kakuli packs back in action alongside lions, warthogs, buffalo, leopards, elephants and hyenas.

programme.title: Wild Dogs: Running with the Pack
programme.sub-title: Its 100 degrees and rising; as waterholes dry up, Julz is alarmed to find lions in the Kakuli packs favourite drinking spot but also gets to touch a wild dog for the first time ever.
programme.desc: Wildlife cameraman Julz Braatvedt visits the South Luangwa National Park in eastern Zambia to follow three wild dog packs for six weeks during the dry season.

programme.title: The Yorkshire Vet
programme.sub-title: Peter rushes into Skeldale on his day off to try to save a lamb of Richard Bells, and Julians treating a very poorly one-week old llama called Noah at Suzanne Bensons trekking centre.
programme.desc: Skeldales team have a real passion for animals; with a clientele that rarely has insurance, animal welfare always comes before profit together with an extra dose of tender loving care.

programme.title: The Yorkshire Vet
programme.sub-title: Julian heads to the historic Harewood House near Leeds to check on some goats who are moving to a new enclosure, and Peter heads over to help when a young farmer struggles with a tricky lambing.
programme.desc: Skeldales team have a real passion for animals; with a clientele that rarely has insurance, animal welfare always comes before profit together with an extra dose of tender loving care.

programme.title: The Yorkshire Vet
programme.sub-title: Julian is at Jackies alpaca farm to see one of his favourite alpacas, and Peters at Arthur Almonds farm because three of his cows need dehorning... but they arent used to being handled.
programme.desc: Skeldales team have a real passion for animals; with a clientele that rarely has insurance, animal welfare always comes before profit together with an extra dose of tender loving care.

programme.title: The Yorkshire Vet
programme.sub-title: Its Sunday morning, but its no day of rest for Julian as he heads to the Taylors farm; at Skeldale, shih-tzu puppy Lester - who needs surgery on a hernia - has all the staff purring.
programme.desc: Skeldales team have a real passion for animals; with a clientele that rarely has insurance, animal welfare always comes before profit together with an extra dose of tender loving care.

programme.title: Wild Belgium
programme.sub-title: Belgiums streams and rivers are home to countless beavers, cunning grass snakes, and male sticklebacks who build intricate nests and prove to be incredibly dedicated and caring fathers.
programme.desc: We bring the insanely wild and wonderful nature of Belgium to screens over three episodes, and the remaining pieces of wild Belgian nature will teach us to see Mother Nature in a brand-new light.

programme.title: Wild Belgium
programme.sub-title: Migratory birds begin their annual journey south and like to stop off in the Belgium countryside; the gathering of cranes and their spectacular departure is a breathtaking spectacle.
programme.desc: We bring the insanely wild and wonderful nature of Belgium to screens over three episodes, and the remaining pieces of wild Belgian nature will teach us to see Mother Nature in a brand-new light.

programme.title: Wild Belgium
programme.sub-title: Belgiums forests hide some unusual behaviour; antlions violently pull their prey into sand funnels to feed their larvae while carnivorous sundew plants trap unwary insects with their slimy tentacles.
programme.desc: We bring the insanely wild and wonderful nature of Belgium to screens over three episodes, and the remaining pieces of wild Belgian nature will teach us to see Mother Nature in a brand-new light.

programme.title: Wildlife in Windmill Country
programme.desc: This documentary takes us on a journey of discovery through the Alblasserwaard, unveiling the wild side of this classic and bucolic Dutch landscape throughout the change of seasons.

programme.title: The Bizarre Pet Vets
programme.sub-title: Dr James sees an emergency case involving two pets, Dr Kiara has concerns about a lump on blue-tongue skink Edward, and Dr Kelly performs tiny surgery on two very small German ram fish.
programme.desc: Dr James Haberfield and his team from Unusual Pet Vets treat the most bizarre and beloved animals in Australia; with three clinics across the country, they see hundreds of species every week.

programme.title: Wildest Survival
programme.sub-title: Many animals can be found in the forests and jungles. From Snares penguins in New Zealand to leaf-tailed geckos and fossas in Madagascar, a vast array of species have made their home among the trees.
programme.desc: We explore the extraordinary lives of natures wildest, most incredible, and sometimes weirdest animals and discover how they have learned to adapt, survive and evolve in every corner of the Earth.

programme.title: Deadly Hunters
programme.sub-title: Careful where you step - hidden beneath logs, in trees, empty burrows and long grass are creatures so deadly that one bite is enough to take down a full-grown elephant.
programme.desc: We take a look at some of the animals that have led the way in refining their skills as masterful huntsmen; using their size, strength and unique weapons, animals use it all in order to survive.

programme.title: Wild Belgium
programme.sub-title: Belgiums streams and rivers are home to countless beavers, cunning grass snakes, and male sticklebacks who build intricate nests and prove to be incredibly dedicated and caring fathers.
programme.desc: We bring the insanely wild and wonderful nature of Belgium to screens over three episodes, and the remaining pieces of wild Belgian nature will teach us to see Mother Nature in a brand-new light.

programme.desc: We bring the insanely wild and wonderful nature of Belgium to screens over three episodes, and the remaining pieces of wild Belgian nature will teach us to see Mother Nature in a brand-new light.

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.sub-title: On his first River Monsters investigation, Jeremy was propelled into a mountain river by a goonch catfish as big as himself. Ten years on, he fears such fish may now be extinct.
programme.desc: Extreme angler Jeremy Wade is on the hunt for freshwater fish with a taste for human flesh. Using forensic methods, Jeremy illustrates to the viewer how these river monsters are constructed to kill.

programme.title: Wildlife Rescue Australia
programme.sub-title: Patsy the echidna has arrived for a check-up of her broken beak, Olly the pelican has a massive tear in his pouch and wont survive unless the team can fix it, and Crash the bandicoot has lost his mum.
programme.desc: At the Byron Bay Wildlife Hospital, Dr Bree and her team are dedicated to saving Australian wildlife; they treat every animal - from tiny echidnas to koalas and kangaroos - from their vet truck.

programme.title: Deadly Hunters
programme.sub-title: Careful where you step - hidden beneath logs, in trees, empty burrows and long grass are creatures so deadly that one bite is enough to take down a full-grown elephant.
programme.desc: We take a look at some of the animals that have led the way in refining their skills as masterful huntsmen; using their size, strength and unique weapons, animals use it all in order to survive.

programme.title: Wonders of Mexico
programme.sub-title: The temples of the Maya tower over the forests of the Yucatan; the watery underworld is still being explored and holds the key to how animals and people survive the dry season.
programme.desc: This documentary series reveals Mexicos astonishing wildlife, landscape and culture as we pay a visit to the ancient temples of the Maya, the Sierra Madre, and the Sonoran and Chihuahuan deserts.

programme.title: A Year on Planet Earth
programme.sub-title: Winter has begun as the Northern Hemisphere freezes; life is at its hardest with less solar energy, and the Arctic sun has set and wont return until the spring.
programme.desc: We journey around the Sun in this series and witness the incredible strategies that animals use to cope with every season in their constantly changing worlds.

programme.title: A Year on Planet Earth
programme.sub-title: Transformation is enormous as the Northern Hemisphere starts to face the suns rays in March; spring is a season of opportunity as the great melt begins and new life erupts.
programme.desc: We journey around the Sun in this series and witness the incredible strategies that animals use to cope with every season in their constantly changing worlds.

programme.title: The Worlds Most Beautiful Landscapes
programme.sub-title: We explore the extraordinary landscape of Snowdonia, from the wildlife of the Llyn Peninsula to slate mines, rainforest, and the magnificent peaks of Tryfan and Mount Snowdon itself.
programme.desc: Travel through the worlds most beautiful landscapes; from wide views to the tiniest close-up, witness spectacular footage and discover the glories of rivers, jungles, and mountains from every angle.

programme.title: Malawi Wildlife Rescue
programme.sub-title: A leg infection hampers a young duikers release, Dr Amanda tracks and collars a young lion, and we check on an ailing bush baby and greet a new addition to the centre, a grumpy grey parrot.
programme.desc: The team at the Lilongwe Wildlife Trust in Malawi in Africa are dedicated to rescuing and rehabilitating injured and orphaned animals, ensuring they get back into the wild where they belong.

programme.title: The Bizarre Pet Vets
programme.sub-title: Dr James treats a Boyds Forest dragon at the clinic, Dr Shane treats a carpet python called Red, and Dr Catherine sees an emergency case; sun conure parakeet Tequila is in a lot of pain.
programme.desc: Dr James Haberfield and his team from Unusual Pet Vets treat the most bizarre and beloved animals in Australia; with three clinics across the country, they see hundreds of species every week.

programme.title: Wildest Survival
programme.sub-title: Some species have baffled scientists. We discover the biological marvel that is the saiga antelope, the odd diets of the gelada baboons and greater bamboo lemurs and much more.
programme.desc: We explore the extraordinary lives of natures wildest, most incredible, and sometimes weirdest animals and discover how they have learned to adapt, survive and evolve in every corner of the Earth.

programme.title: The Yorkshire Vet
programme.sub-title: An emotional emergency for Peter at a friends farm; Steves wife is seriously ill, and now her favourite sheeps life is in the balance. Julian tries to remove an abscess on Karine the alpacas chin.
programme.desc: Skeldales team have a real passion for animals; with a clientele that rarely has insurance, animal welfare always comes before profit together with an extra dose of tender loving care.

programme.title: The Yorkshire Vet
programme.sub-title: Peter faces a difficult calving at Ed McDonalds farm; can he get a baby out alive and save mum? Also, Julian faces one of his biggest ever challenges trying to treat one-ton Clydesdale horse Howard.
programme.desc: Skeldales team have a real passion for animals; with a clientele that rarely has insurance, animal welfare always comes before profit together with an extra dose of tender loving care.

programme.title: Wild Dogs: Running with the Pack
programme.sub-title: Its Julzs last week; an encounter with lions scatters the Stork pack, Julz spots the Kakuli puppies feeding on a puku carcass, and the Manzi pack fight a warthog by the Luangwa River.
programme.desc: Wildlife cameraman Julz Braatvedt visits the South Luangwa National Park in eastern Zambia to follow three wild dog packs for six weeks during the dry season.

programme.title: Wild Dogs: Pack vs Pride
programme.sub-title: Join Julz and park scout Simon Chulu as they track the Kakuli pack and a Manzi faction thats ditched a tracking collar and broken away from the group.
programme.desc: Cameraman Julz Braatvedt returns to the South Luangwa National Park to see the Kakumbi, Manzi and Kakuli packs back in action alongside lions, warthogs, buffalo, leopards, elephants and hyenas.

programme.title: Wild Dogs: Running with the Pack
programme.sub-title: Its 100 degrees and rising; as waterholes dry up, Julz is alarmed to find lions in the Kakuli packs favourite drinking spot but also gets to touch a wild dog for the first time ever.
programme.desc: Wildlife cameraman Julz Braatvedt visits the South Luangwa National Park in eastern Zambia to follow three wild dog packs for six weeks during the dry season.

programme.title: Wonders of Mexico
programme.sub-title: The temples of the Maya tower over the forests of the Yucatan; the watery underworld is still being explored and holds the key to how animals and people survive the dry season.
programme.desc: This documentary series reveals Mexicos astonishing wildlife, landscape and culture as we pay a visit to the ancient temples of the Maya, the Sierra Madre, and the Sonoran and Chihuahuan deserts.

programme.title: Wild Fighters
programme.sub-title: We often witness combats of all kinds in the animal kingdom - from hand-to-hand fighting to fierce fashion shows and extravagant tournaments - but what is behind all these wild competitions?
programme.desc: Animals fight to ensure their survival, but what are the reasons that make them risk their lives every day, and what are the consequences of winning or losing these battles?

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.sub-title: Jeremy is thrown into his most dangerous challenge to date as stories of a lake monster lure him to Chernobyls reactor number 4 in Ukraine; in a race against time, can he uncover the culprit?
programme.desc: Extreme angler Jeremy Wade is on the hunt for freshwater fish with a taste for human flesh. Using forensic methods, Jeremy illustrates to the viewer how these river monsters are constructed to kill.

programme.title: Deadly Hunters
programme.sub-title: Dont be fooled - small creatures are seasoned in survival. What they lack in size they make up for in power, strength and tenacity, from porcupines and spotted genets to caracals.
programme.desc: We take a look at some of the animals that have led the way in refining their skills as masterful huntsmen; using their size, strength and unique weapons, animals use it all in order to survive.

programme.desc: Eastern Poland is one of Europes last wild regions; the Biebrza lowlands make up the biggest national park in Poland and are of the utmost value for beavers, otters and countless aquatic birds.

programme.title: Wild Talk
programme.sub-title: We learn about the variety of sounds animals use when they need to communicate; with the help of scientists, we eavesdrop into the secret conversations going on all around us in the animal kingdom.
programme.desc: Recent years have seen an explosion of research into zoosemiotics (the science of animal communications); experts are listening to animals on their own terms to decode their secret languages.

programme.title: Natures Fast Attacks
programme.sub-title: This first episode features footage showing the lightning-fast moves that predators deploy to capture their prey and the rapid escape tactics that will see who wins these high-velocity battles.
programme.desc: In this two-part documentary series, we see footage that captures the lightning-fast moves used to ambush prey and make equally rapid escapes in the terrifying moments between life and death.

programme.title: Natures Fast Attacks
programme.sub-title: In the battle between predator and prey, we explore how deception and speed can often be the difference between life and death; even some of the fastest hunters use stealth to trick their prey.
